bibl.title: In Re: Ex Parte - Turner Jackson Petitioner For A Writ of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image.

msIdentifier.repository: National Archives and Records Administration, Seattle Branch, Washington
msIdentifier.collection: RG 21 US District Court Western Division of Washington, Seattle

div1.p: In The United States Ciruit Court, For the Ninth Juidicial Circuit, Western Division of the State of Washington, Northern Division.
In re. Parte: Turner Jackson, Petitioner, Stipulation.

It is hereby stipulated and agreed, that, the Honor- able C.H. Hanford, Judge of the above entitled Court, agreeing thereto, this matter shall be heard as of a final hearinb and as of the date of September 9th, A.D. 1905, upon the petitioner, writ, return, and demurrer herein, that the decision of said Court rendered thereon shall be fine and determinaive of the matters involved herein, and if the siad Court shall determine that the said Turner Jackson is unlawfully held upon said 9th day of September, A.D. 1905, as a prisoner in the penitentiary at McNeill's Island, that thereupon said prisoner shallbe immediately discharged without the necessity of further action or hearing thereupon.
Jesse A Frye, United States Attorney. Wm. H. Briker, R. s. Jones, Attorneys for Turner Jackson.
